Additional considerations included the magnitude of the effect, presence or absence 
of a dose-response gradient, and direction of plausible biases. GRADE tables from 
systematic reviews were cross-checked, and a discussion on benefits and harms, values 
and preferences of health care providers and policy-makers, and whether costs are 
qualitatively justifiable compared to the benefits in LMICs was drafted. No efforts were
